STUDENT A. C. TO HOLD
MEETING TO-DAY
To-day, at 12:30. the Student
Activities Council will hold a
meeting .in 119 M. E. Building. The purpose of the meeting is to dishiss the awarding
of Varsity Seals to seniors.
It is imperative that all members attend, as an effort is being made this year to cut the
number of seals given out to
a minimum, awarding them
only to those who absolutely
deserve them.

JUNIOR CLASS TO HOLD
MEETING TO-DAY
To-day, at 12:20 I'. M., in
the C. E. Hall, the Junior class
will ho1d a meeting for the
purpose of electing a successor to John F. Markle, whp
resigned from the Student
Council two months ago. Nominations will be received to-day
and the election will be held
next Friday.
At to-day's meeting the Jun- ior dance comtnittee will be announced by the President of
the class.

"Gus wants to see you"

In the absence of Ben Kolb, editor of the Black and Blue Jay, Rigby McDorman, Managing Editor,
took charge of the regtilar Tuesday
meeting of the Art and Editorial
staffs and candidates. The general
subject for the next issue was announced, and as- previously decided,
the main theme will be that of travel
with a subordinate one of dramatics.
As the issue will appear the first
week in March, a few days before
the Barnstormer production, it was
thought advisable to. include dra'matic niatte,4„jn with the travel copy.
Copy *ile due a week from today, and for the main part jokes
and short sketches less than a thousand words, are desired. There will
be a meeting of the Editorial and
Art staffs next Tuesday at the Jay
office. All candidates for these staffs
are invited to attend.

DINING and DANCING

INTER COLLEGIATE
NEWS
It is considered a breach of ettiquette for Oxford University women to walk on the streets with Oxford men. We wonder how carefully a Hopkins man would observe
such a ruling.
• • •
Certain men in one of Southwestern College's dormitories, are too
desirous of exhibiting their manly
forms in front of the windows and
have forced the College authorities
to paint the windows white.

'86, of Detroit, presented to the
University of Michigan a unique
gift in the form of a complete set of
autographed letters and documents
of the Emperor Napoleon I, and
his marshalls, as well as the autographs of several of the generals
and members of the cabinet, being

deserve them.

In the absence of Ben Kolb, editor of the Black and Blue Jay, Rigby McDorman, Managing Editor,
took charge of the regtilar Tuesday
meeting of the Art and Editorial
staffs and candidates. The general
subject for the next issue was announced, and as- previously decided,
the main theme will be that of travel
with a subordinate one of dramatics.
As the issue will appear the first
week in March, a few days before
the Barnstormer production, it was
thought advisable to. include dra'matic niatte,4„jn with the travel copy.
Copy *ile due a week from today, and for the main part jokes
and short sketches less than a thousand words, are desired. There will
be a meeting of the Editorial and
Art staffs next Tuesday at the Jay
office. All candidates for these staffs
are invited to attend.
